contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox software license | author = Bruce Dodson<ref>{{cite mailing list |url=http://crynwr.com/cgi-bin/ezmlm-cgi?3:mss:6305:jggiiehpeekebdbmpopm |title=discuss: approval request: "Historical Permission Notice and Disclaimer" |mailinglist=license-discuss |date=29 November 2002 |first=Bruce |last=Dodson }}</ref> | version = n/a | copyright = Bruce Dodson | date = 29 November 2002 | OSI approved = Yes | Debian approved = ? | Free Software = Yes{{Citation needed|date=September 2009}} | GPL compatible = Yes{{Citation needed|date=September 2009}} | copyleft = No | linking = Yes }} The '''Historical Permission Notice and Disclaimer''' is an [[open source license]], approved by the [[Open Source Initiative]] (OSI). It is unique among the OSI's licenses because of the choices it allows in its construction; it lets the licensor pick anywhere from 0-2 warranty disclaimers, whether they want to prohibit your publicity of the software derivatives (like in the [[BSD License]]), and other spelling and grammar options. Besides this, the license can be almost functionally identical to the new 3-clause BSD License (if the option for the no-promotion clause is exercised), or the [[MIT License]] (if the option for the no-promotion clause is not exercised). Variants of this license are in use primarily in older software, including the original [[BSD kernel]], developed by [[IBM]], [[Intel]] and others. Today, it is most popular to choose either the new 3-clause BSD License or the MIT License to meet the licensing needs of the developer. This is the only OSI-certified license (excluding the [[public domain]]) that can lack a disclaimer of warranty. The [[Free Software Foundation]] has not yet recognized this license as a [[free software license]] in the general case, but has done so for certain variations, such as that used for versions of [[Python (programming language)|Python]] before 1.6b.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.gnu.org/licenses/license-list.html#GPLCompatibleLicenses |title=GPL-Compatible Free Software Licenses |publisher=[[Free Software Foundation]] |first=Richard |last=Stallman |date=7 March 2008 |accessdate=2008-03-16 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.python.org/download/releases/2.5/license |title=Python 2.5 license |publisher=Python.org |accessdate=2008-03-16 }}</ref> ==References== {{reflist|2}} ==External links== *[http://www.opensource.org/licenses/historical.php Text of the license] {{DEFAULTSORT:Historical Permission Notice And Disclaimer}} [[Category:Free and open-source software licenses]]
